subject: WOST
name: Honors: Intro Women's Studies
info: U.S. multicultural/cross-cultural studies of contemporary social, cultural, and personal conditions of women's lives. Recitation.

subject: WOST
name: Honors: Intro Gender Studies
info: Surveys historical, cultural, psychological, and social dimensions of analyzing gender. How various groups (based on race, class, sexual orientation, ethnicity, region) have different understandings of gender ideals/deviances. Recitation.

subject: WOST
name: Sexuality Studies
info: Interdisciplinary survey of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender studies.  Includes honors recitation.

subject: WOST
name: Honors:Intro Sexuality Studies
info: Interdisciplinary survey of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender studies. Recitation.

subject: WOST
name: Femin Expos Writing
info: Stages of composition process.  Similarities/differences between feminist and traditional expository language/structure. Analysis/criticism.

subject: WOST
name: A Sense of Identity
info: Exploration of social and psychological factors that affect a woman's continuously developing sense of identity.  Emphasis is on assertion and communication skills development.

subject: WOST
name: Gender/Geopolitics
info: Gendered theory and practice of geopolitics. Critique of the gendered nature of conventional international relations theory.

subject: WOST
name: Comm, Serv, Self
fullname: Community, Service, and Self: Dynamics of Gender, Race, and Class
info: Combines theoretical exploration of models of community service with hands-on involvement in local communities.

subject: WOST
name: Comm, Serv, Self
fullname: Community, Service, and Self: Dynamics of Gender, Race, and Class
info: Year-long, six-credit offering (with Wost 3501) that combines a theoretical exploration of models of community service with hands-on involvement in local communities.

subject: WOST
name: Wmn Writ:Af Lat Am
fullname: Women Writers of Africa and Latin America
info: Contemporary women writers from Sub-Saharan Africa and Latin America, including the Spanish-speaking Caribbean.  Fiction, poems, plays, and essays in light of gender relations, feminist theory, and the history of colonialism.

subject: WOST
name: Women and the Law
info: Legal system as it relates to women: historical legal approach to issues related to constitutional rights of women.

subject: WOST
name: Internat Femin Thry
info: Western and non-western feminist theories in conversation.  Attention to historical, cultural, and political context; the relation of theory to activism.

subject: WOST
name: Cult Constr Sex/Gen/Sexuality
fullname: The Cultural Construction of Sex, Gender, and Sexuality
info: Investigation of Euro-American concepts of sex, gender, sexuality in representative texts and images from the 17th century to the present.  Critical and source materials from literary and cultural studies, history, biology, anthropology, psychology, and sociology.

subject: WOST
name: Feminist Therapies
info: Feminist and multicultural perspectives regarding therapy and other helping forms for women, including philosophy of feminist theory; feminist ethics in therapy; gender, sexual identity, race and class in therapy, and related topics.

subject: WOST
name: Hist:West Feminism
info: Survey of the main currents in the history of Western feminist thought, politics, and social movements from the 1770s to the present.

subject: WOST
name: Women Indig Land St
info: Representative land struggles by indigenous women from a critical race and gender perspective.

subject: WOST
name: Soc of Gender
info: Organization, culture, dynamics of gender relations and gendered social structures. Gender, race, and class inequalities in the workplace; the women's movement; social welfare and politics of gender inequality; gender and science; theoretical debates in gender theory and methods; sexuality; cultural studies of gender; sociology of emotions.
